result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF165, 22TR702, 22TR703, 22TR0704, & 22TR705.  Court reviews files. Atty Dolfi states they're still on track for Jury Trial.  Court schedules one more final pretrial. Cut off for negotiations is 12/19/22.  If no agreement is reached all motions, jury instructions and witness lists are due by 12/22/22.  Any motions that require a hearing to be filed before 12/19/22.  Bond continues in form and amount. 3:34 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ismail Mohamed Hussein in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Ismail Mohamed Hussein. Includes 22CF165, 22TR702, 22TR703, 22TR704, & 22TR705. Court reviews file.  Atty Petersen states DE is requesting to have her withdraw, DE is also asking for bond modification. DE did not put in writing that he wants her withdrawn from the case, Court directs DE to do so now.  Atty Petersen makes argument regarding bond modification.  ADA Rockow objects.  Court makes statements and denies modification of bond.  Court maintains bond in form and amount.  Court will reset this matter in hopes to have a new attorney appointed. Court will keep JT scheduled for now.  Adjourned at 3:44 PM. bph

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty M. Petersen. km
Filed by DA Office. confidential. arc
Pretrial assessment report. Sealed. arc
Preliminary hearing on March 22, 2022 at 08:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ismail Mohamed Hussein
Current: 2216 24th Ave Apt 302, Minneapolis, MN   (Effective: 03-15-2022)
Prior: 2433 5th Ave S, Apt 606, Minneapolis, MN

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, M.W or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-  I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. Defendant to contact Justice Support Center 1 time per week for address verification. (715)245-4109

01:25 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Christianson, ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson and Derek Sanders for today, DF: Ismail Mohamed Hussein appeared from jail.
